anxiety.definition: Anxiety is your body's natural response to stress, involving worry, fear, and physical symptoms like racing heart, sweating, or difficulty breathing.
immediate_relief: 4-7-8 breathing: Inhale for 4, hold for 7, exhale for 8
Grounding technique: Name 5 things you see, 4 you hear, 3 you touch, 2 you smell, 1 you taste
Physical movement: Walk, stretch, or exercise
Cold water on face: Splash cold water to reset nervous system
Talk to someone: Call a friend or family member
long_term_solutions: Regular exercise: 30 minutes daily reduces anxiety by 20%
Meditation: 10-15 minutes daily
Limit caffeine and alcohol
Maintain sleep schedule: 7-8 hours nightly
Journaling: Write thoughts and feelings
Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT): Professional help
Social connection: Regular time with friends
Limit news and social media consumption
anxiety.when_to_seek_help: Anxiety that lasts 2+ weeks, interferes with daily life, causes panic attacks, or prevents you from working/socializing

depression.definition: Depression is a mood disorder causing persistent sadness, loss of interest in activities, and difficulty with daily functioning. It's more than just feeling sad.
impacts: Loss of interest in activities you enjoyed
Sleep changes (too much or too little)
immediate_relief: Get sunlight: 15-30 minutes outdoors (increases serotonin)
Move your body: Even 10-minute walk helps
Eat something nourishing: Blood sugar affects mood
Reach out: Call or text someone
Do one small thing: Shower, make bed, brush teeth
Limit isolation: Get around people, even online
long_term_solutions: Daily routine: Wake, sleep, eat at consistent times
Exercise: 3-5 times weekly (as effective as some antidepressants)
Social connection: Weekly meaningful interaction
Professional help: Therapy or medication
Reduce alcohol and drugs
Challenge negative thoughts: Question 'I'm worthless'
Set small achievable goals
Nature time: Parks, gardens, outdoor activities
depression.when_to_seek_help: URGENT if suicidal thoughts, self-harm urges, or unable to care for yourself. Otherwise, if lasting 2+ weeks despite self-care efforts
resources: Crisis Text Line: Text HOME to 741741

stress.definition: Stress is your body's reaction to demands or threats. Short-term stress can be helpful, but chronic stress damages physical and mental health.
immediate_relief: Deep breathing: Slow, deep breaths for 2-3 minutes
Progressive muscle relaxation: Tense and release each muscle group
Take a break: Step away from stressor for 15 minutes
Physical activity: Brief exercise releases endorphins
Laugh: Watch funny videos or call a friend
Warm bath or shower: Relaxes body and mind
long_term_solutions: Identify stressors: What specifically is causing stress?
Set boundaries: Learn to say no
Time management: Prioritize and break tasks into steps
Regular exercise: 4-5 times weekly
Adequate sleep: 7-9 hours nightly
Hobbies and relaxation: Daily enjoyable activities
Social support: Regular connection with loved ones
Consider therapy: Learn stress management techniques
stress.when_to_seek_help: If stress causes physical symptoms, doesn't improve with self-care, or affects work/relationships for more than a month

sleep_issues.definition: Sleep issues range from difficulty falling/staying asleep to poor sleep quality. Consistent poor sleep impacts every aspect of health and mood.
root_causes: Caffeine, alcohol, or screens before bed
immediate_relief: No screens 1 hour before bed: Blue light disrupts melatonin
Cool, dark room: Temperature 60-67Â°F is ideal
White noise: Fan, app, or nature sounds
Warm milk or chamomile tea: Contains sleep-promoting compounds
Warm bath: Drops body temperature after, promoting sleep
Avoid clock watching: Increases anxiety about not sleeping
long_term_solutions: Consistent schedule: Same sleep/wake time daily (even weekends)
No caffeine after 2 PM: Half-life is 5-6 hours
Exercise: But not within 3 hours of bed
Limit alcohol: Disrupts sleep quality despite making you drowsy
Optimize bedroom: Dark, quiet, cool, comfortable
CBT-I: Cognitive behavioral therapy for insomnia (very effective)
Meditation or progressive relaxation before bed
Limit naps: Short 20-30 minute naps only
sleep_issues.when_to_seek_help: If sleep issues persist 3+ months despite lifestyle changes, or if you're experiencing loud snoring or breathing stops

self_esteem.definition: Self-esteem is how you view and value yourself. Low self-esteem involves persistent self-doubt, negative self-talk, and feeling unworthy.
types: Fragile self-esteem (overly dependent on others' approval)
immediate_relief: Stop comparing: Unfollow social media accounts that trigger comparison
Self-compassion: Talk to yourself like a good friend
Celebrate small wins: Acknowledge daily accomplishments
Limit negative self-talk: Notice and challenge critical thoughts
Spend time with supportive people: Avoid critical people
Do something you're good at: Builds confidence
long_term_solutions: Identify negative beliefs: Where did 'I'm not good enough' come from?
Challenge thinking patterns: Question evidence for negative thoughts
Build competence: Learn skills and practice
Set and achieve small goals: Builds self-trust
Practice self-compassion: Treat yourself with kindness
Therapy: Address root causes and rebuild esteem
Gratitude practice: Daily appreciation for yourself
Limit social media: Reduces comparison
self_esteem.when_to_seek_help: If low self-esteem leads to depression, anxiety, self-harm, or prevents you from pursuing opportunities

dopamine.definition: Dopamine is a brain chemical linked to motivation, pleasure, and focus. Dopamine dysregulation causes lack of motivation, difficulty concentrating, and addiction-like behavior.
impacts: Lack of motivation for important tasks
immediate_relief: Dopamine detox: 24-48 hours without stimulating activities (no phone, games, social media)
Cold exposure: Cold shower activates dopamine
Movement: Exercise immediately increases dopamine
Sunlight: 15-30 minutes outdoors
Accomplishment: Complete one small task for dopamine hit
Limit artificial stimulation: Reduce phone, social media, gaming
long_term_solutions: Dopamine fasting: Regular periods without stimulation
Gradually increase dopamine baseline: Healthy activities only
Exercise regularly: 30 minutes 4-5 times weekly
Set meaningful goals: Work toward them for natural dopamine
Improve sleep: Critical for dopamine regulation
Reduce processed foods: Especially sugar and processed carbs
Social connection: Meaningful relationships boost dopamine
Novelty and challenge: New skills and activities
dopamine.when_to_seek_help: If unable to function without constant stimulation, or if dopamine-seeking behaviors are harmful

loneliness.definition: Loneliness is the painful feeling of disconnection from others. It's not about being alone, but feeling alone even around people.
types: Situational loneliness (temporary, after loss or move)
immediate_relief: Reach out: Text or call someone, even briefly
Online connection: Discord, Reddit, or interest-based communities
Volunteer: Help others, meet people with shared values
Go to public spaces: Coffee shop, library, gym
Join a group: Hobby, exercise, book club, class
Social media: Connect meaningfully, not passively scrolling
long_term_solutions: Build relationships gradually: Small interactions first
Find your people: Join groups around genuine interests
Maintain relationships: Consistent contact with people you like
Address social anxiety: Therapy to overcome fear
Quality over quantity: One deep friendship beats many shallow
Self-love: Enjoy your own company first
Community involvement: Regular group activities
Professional help: Therapy if depression develops
loneliness.when_to_seek_help: If loneliness leads to depression, suicidal thoughts, or prevents you from functioning

burnout.definition: Burnout is emotional exhaustion from chronic work stress. It involves exhaustion, cynicism, and reduced effectiveness. It's different from regular tiredness.
immediate_relief: Take time off: Full days without work thoughts
Set boundaries: No work outside work hours
Delegate tasks: You can't do everything
Take short breaks: Hourly 5-minute pauses
Physical activity: Releases stress hormones
Talk about it: Share struggles with trusted person
Do something fun: Hobbies unrelated to work
long_term_solutions: Reassess job fit: Is this the right role?
Improve work-life balance: Non-negotiable personal time
Communicate with manager: About workload and support
Develop hobbies: Identity beyond work
Regular exercise: 4-5 times weekly
Professional help: Therapy or coaching
Consider job change: If workplace is toxic
Build support network: Close relationships
burnout.when_to_seek_help: If burnout causes depression, health problems, or you're considering quitting without a plan
